/3/ - 3DCG

Images and discussion should relate to 3D modelling and imagery.

Remember: This is a worksafe board! No adult content is allowed.

/a/ - Anime & Manga

1. All images and resulting discussion should pertain to anime or manga. For long-term series discussion, please refer to the http://dis.4chan.org/anime/ board.

2. The use of spoiler tags is highly recommended. To spoilerise text, enclose it like so: [spoiler]spoiled text[/spoiler]. In addition, images may be spoilerised by checking the "[Spoiler Image?]" box on the submission form.

3. Purposeful spoiling of a series may result in post deletion and temporary ban.

4. The discussion of "live action" television shows is permitted so long as they are distinctly rooted in, or based off of an anime or manga series.

5. Japanese visual novels should be posted in http://boards.4chan.org/jp/ , and Western on http://boards.4chan.org/vg/ .

/ck/ - Food & Cooking

1. Images and discussion should relate to food and cooking.

2. Recipes are welcome! Feel free to talk about your favourite dishes and discuss past cooking experiences.

/hr/ - High Resolution

1. Post quality high-resolution 2D/3D artwork, scans, photography, and images of interest here.

2. Do not simply post images because they have large dimensions. If an image would be of interest to another board, please crosspost the image (resising if necessary).

3. The high resolution board was created to provide a venue for extremely large images. It is not intended to be a random board.

4. Non-worksafe images are allowed, however content must be kept tasteful (no grossout images).

/n/ - Transportation

1. All sorts of transportation pictures and discussion welcome. Trains, planes, ships, bicycles, flying lifts - post \'em all!

2. Please keep automobiles on the auto board.

3. Military vehicles should be posted on the weapons board.

/trv/ - Travel

1. Post images and information about various locales, places you\'ve travelled, or hope to visit in the future.

2. Feel free to ask questions about other cultures, and post in native languages.

3. This board is for all the countries of the world. The more diverse, the better!
